{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3395301,"name":"Techmakerpro","username":"Techpro","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-04T20:10:23.678Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone,

I am having an issue with the integration of the AdvantageKit code. I have already managed to resolve the alignment problem, but now the wheels keep locking in a specific position on the control. Here is a link to the video (it is a bit outdated, as I have since resolved the alignment issue) - Video Link and here is the GitHub code - GitHub Repository. Finally, the log files are attached.

Thank you in advance!
TechMaker-LogFiles.zip (4.8 MB)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-06-04T20:10:23.678Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467228,"topic_slug":"advantagekit-integration-error","display_username":"Techmakerpro","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pyoKjC27LgXL7JVK-jw-shRMumHJ08Hf/view?usp=sharing","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"WhatsApp Video 2024-05-28 at 16.10.38.mp4 - Google Drive","clicks":10},{"url":"https://github.com/TechMakerRobotics-frc/AdvantageKit-Swerve-Johnny","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - TechMakerRobotics-frc/AdvantageKit-Swerve-Johnny","clicks":6},{"url":"/uploads/short-url/y1uynbAsbSc86MWbFmAg9SYoZSk.zip","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"TechMaker Robotics (:-o)"},"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/advantagekit-integration-error/467228/1","custom_user_title":"TechMaker Robotics (:-o)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3396548,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-08T02:24:26.963Z","cooked":"

The issue you’re referring to is the rattling sound the wheels are making while accelerating, correct?

If so, this would be related to the PID gains for the drive motor. I would recommend plotting the measured and setpoint speeds under “RealOutputs/SwerveStates” to check how the control loop is tracking the setpoint. As you can see in the image below, there are periods where the measured velocity is oscillating around the setpoint; this would create the rattling sounds you’re hearing.

Screenshot 2024-06-07 at 10.20.07 PM1624×784 30 KB

As a first step, you should try running the robot on the ground. The inertia of the robot changes the behavior of the system, so rattling noises while running in the air is to be expected. The AdvantageKit template includes a set of gains which should behave reasonably, but you may want to tune them further to improve the behavior (reducing error between measured/setpoint and avoiding oscillation). If you aren’t familiar with PID tuning, the WPILib documentation includes an excellent interactive tutorial.

Let me know if you have further questions.
